description: gone! Again that dip, again it turns in from outside off, but this time it pitched fuller, and hit his front pad juust about in line with off stump when he came forward to defend. wktDetails:
205. MJ Guptill lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 38.0: v New Zealand at Eden Gardens in 2016 (2nd innings)

Richard Kettleborough didn't hesitate to give that out, and I suspect it was plumb, hitting in front of middle and off or thereabouts. In front of off stump.
wktDetails:
206. LRPL Taylor lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 38.0: v New Zealand at Eden Gardens in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: got him, and that's a beauty of a delivery. Floated it up high and inviting, wide of off. Drives away from his body and nicks to Saha. Didn't get to the pitch of it at all.
wktDetails:
207. TWM Latham c WP Saha b Ashwin
Test Match#: 38.0: v New Zealand at Eden Gardens in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: teasing little offbreak. Worse, it had masqueraded as a half-volley on the pads. Poor Latham thought he had a single for the taking, bringing his bat across his front pad and playing with a closed face. But the ball - a lot slower in pace, that was the key to the wicket - lobs up off the leading edge and Ashwin takes an absolute dolly of a catch.
wktDetails:
208. TWM Latham c R Ashwin b Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (1st innings)

description: dragged on! He's played Ashwin's good-length balls off the back foot, not entirely a terrible ploy, but the problem arose when he went for the cut. A straight bat could have saved him, but the horizontal one simply made him feel more cramped and it presents the ball with the perfect opportunity to take the inside edge and trickle onto the stumps. Rare mistake from Williamson..
wktDetails:
209. KS Williamson b  Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (1st innings)

description: it's the straight one! Oh, wait. It turned just a tiny bit. Taylor was just playing too far inside the line. And he has this technique as well where he doesn't push too far forward and the bat comes down at an angle from gully. Ashwin, by pulling his length back, gets the outside edge and Rahane mops things up.
wktDetails:
210. LRPL Taylor c AM Rahane b Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (1st innings)

description: off the thigh of the keeper to the first slip. Superb work from Rahane, diving to his right. Outstanding reflexes. The delivery wasn't too bad either. Drifted away from Ronchi, who had come forward expecting top block a good length ball and suddenly finding that he was playing inside the line. Fine edge, hitchhikes its way to India's vice-captain.
wktDetails:
211. L Ronchi c AM Rahane b Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (1st innings)

description: hasn't it straightened too much? Umpire Dharmasena thinks not and raises the finger and Ashwin has his 20th five-wicket haul. He wrapped it up with a well flighted delivery that Neesham played all around with a sweep. Struck on the back thigh, but that back thigh was probably outside the line of off stump. Neesham went back to the dressing room, waited by the monitor to see the replay and then strode off disgusted.
wktDetails:
212. JDS Neesham lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (1st innings)

description: Ashwin has six! shimmes down, looks to heave it towards midwicket, gets a top edge and Pujara takes the catch. A superb one at that, because the ball went so high. Backtracked from midwicket and pulled it off serenely.
wktDetails:
213. TA Boult c CA Pujara b Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (1st innings)

description: big appeal for lbw, Williamson opened himself up for that by going deep in his crease and looks woeful when umpire Oxenford gives him out. It looked dicey. It was a tough decision, mostly in terms of adjudicating how much the ball was spinning. It ripped off a good length from outside off to pin Williamson in front of middle, and with him being so far back, there was not much distance to travel. All in all, a top decision.
wktDetails:
214. KS Williamson lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: sweeps the wrong ball, and Ashwin waves bye-bye to him. It's slower through the air. It's too full for the shot. He should be driving at those, but hitting across the line like that, he's sabotaged himself.
wktDetails:
215. LRPL Taylor b  Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: fooled him! And then messes up his stumps for good measure. It was pretty full delivery, but Ronchi was suckered into playing back because the trajectory was flat. Then just to make the batsman feel like the world is against him, it stays low too..
wktDetails:
216. L Ronchi b  Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: goes straight on, and poor Santner throws a 'how do you do that?' and then an 'is there no mercy in the world?' stare at the celebrating Ashwin. It's the proper offspinner, not even the undercutter. So the batsman was well within his right to expect it to turn. And it does, just not that much. Takes the inside edge, then the pad and onto the stumps. That's 10 in the Test for Ashwin, his 6th time doing so.
wktDetails:
217. MJ Santner b  Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: now he's got a five-for in each innings! That was all a bit too easy. Tossed it up. Patel plays right across the line, trying a sweep while standing up. In effect, he ushered the ball onto his stumps.
wktDetails:
218. JS Patel b  Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: doesn't cost India much! Tossed up well wide of off stump, Henry goes for a slap over mid-off, but the ball dips. Henry can't reach the pitch and he mistimes the ball straight to mid-off instead.
wktDetails:
219. MJ Henry c Mohammed Shami b Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: finishes it off, all by himself! Ashwin has a seventh - his best bowling in an innings, and in a Test match. Looped up to get him out of his crease and look for the drive. The ball dips on him though and it pops back. Watling throws his head down in disappointment. Coach Kumble is catching it all on camera, while the Indian dressing room explodes around him.
wktDetails:
220. TA Boult c R Ashwin b Ashwin
Test Match#: 39.0: v New Zealand at Indore in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: given, and that's a beauty from Ashwin! He's used this angle so brilliantly over these last three balls, and Hameed, with the intention of getthis his front pad out of the way while defending, is hit on the back pad as this drifts a little and goes with the angle to beat his outside edge. Hits him in line, and ball-tracking says it'll hit off stump too, after Hameed reviews it. That just looked out, and England have reviewed when they shouldn't have, after not reviewing when they should have. Hameed's technique, which looked so good so far, exposed a little here - his bat came down curtain rail style, a la KP or Ross Taylor, across the ball rather than down the line of it. Couple that with his front pad moving away from the line of the ball, and he's ended up opening himself up..
wktDetails:
221. H Hameed lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 40.0: v England at Rajkot in 2016 (1st innings)

description: gone! Rahane dives low to his right to take it at slip. Again it's tossed up slightly slower than the pace he's been bowling to Duckett so far, and his front foot is planted too early, moving away from the line of the ball again, and this time the ball turns to find his outside edge as he tries to defend. They go upstairs for the catch - Dharmasena's soft signal is out - and Rahane has scooped it up an inch from the ground. That's a superb catch..
wktDetails:
222. BM Duckett c AM Rahane b Ashwin
Test Match#: 40.0: v England at Rajkot in 2016 (1st innings)

description: there it is, Cook holes out to long-off and England declare. Ashwin finally pockets a wicket and the players all walk off, Cook was trying to be enterprising and stepped out to hit down the ground, didn't get enough on it and Jadeja pouched a safe catch.
wktDetails:
223. AN Cook c RA Jadeja b Ashwin
Test Match#: 40.0: v England at Rajkot in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: cleaned up this time! And in what is already familiar style. It seemed only a matter of time. Duckett standing on leg stump, leaving his stumps exposed, and Ashwin does him like a kipper. Drifted into middle and leg, then gripped enough to turn past the outside edge and into middle stump - which just shows what line Duckett was playing. The Bakerloo, while the ball went down the Piccadilly.
wktDetails:
224. BM Duckett b  Ashwin
Test Match#: 41.0: v England at Visakhapatnam in 2016 (1st innings)

description: oh my goodness! He's picked out long-off...who says he shouldn't be there. That's a horrid moment for Root. Came down the pitch, didn't quite get to the pitch, but went through with the shot and he miscues it to long-off. He was keen to not let Ashwin settle, but England were already in trouble. A rare misjudgement of the moment from Root.
wktDetails:
225. JE Root c UT Yadav b Ashwin
Test Match#: 41.0: v England at Visakhapatnam in 2016 (1st innings)

description: and he's gone! Ashwin strikes. But Stokes has called for the review. He's been given lbw, but it was also caught at silly point. So he could be out either way. Third umpire taking a lot time in deciding if there's bat involved. The bat clips the pad as well. Third umpire says it's not conclusive for bat, but it's three reds for lbw so it won't matter. wktDetails:
226. BA Stokes lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 41.0: v England at Visakhapatnam in 2016 (1st innings)

description: Dharmasena has taken at eternity to give this, and Broad doesn't have a review he can use. This looks leg side to me. Definitely worth a review, but the two men before Broad have wasted the reviews.
wktDetails:
227. SCJ Broad lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 41.0: v England at Visakhapatnam in 2016 (1st innings)

description: Ashwin has got Anderson first ball. He'll be on hat-trick in the second innings. Ashwin has another five-for. India have an option to enforce the follow-on, but they won't do it. Anderson goes back to defend a length ball, but it doesn't turn and catches him on the back foot and dead plumb.
wktDetails:
228. JM Anderson lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 41.0: v England at Visakhapatnam in 2016 (1st innings)

description: a shooter gets Ashwin the wicket. This is like Hooper getting Hussain. Hameed is lbw too. Can't do anything about these. Offbrreak, on a length, outside off, and it just doesn't leave the ground. Squeezes under the toe and strikes him flush in front. If it hadn't hit the pad, it would have bounced twice. Habeeb has seen off 144 balls nonetheless. Well played.
wktDetails:
229. H Hameed lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 41.0: v England at Visakhapatnam in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: and he's gone! Duckett's problems continue. He went for the aggressive option, another sweep, there was a touch of extra bounce from the over-spin, it takes the glove into the thigh pad and loops up to offer Saha a simple catch.
wktDetails:
230. BM Duckett c WP Saha b Ashwin
Test Match#: 41.0: v England at Visakhapatnam in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: cleaned up! Simple as that, really. A touch flatter and quicker, then it gripped. Ansari playing back, spins from outside leg and hammers middle. Kept a bit low, too. Tough..
wktDetails:
231. ZS Ansari b  Ashwin
Test Match#: 41.0: v England at Visakhapatnam in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: who writes their scripts? India have turned it around. And Ashwin it is. He dropped a sitter 10 minutes ago. And this is not a wicket-taking ball either. This is short and wide. wktDetails:
232. AN Cook c PA Patel b Ashwin
Test Match#: 42.0: v England at Mohali in 2016 (1st innings)

wktDetails:
233. AN Cook b  Ashwin
Test Match#: 42.0: v England at Mohali in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: chipped in the air, such a nothing shot, and he is pouched with ease at mid-on! Came down the track, expecting the half-volley, but was bamboozled in flight, tried to check his stroke, and gave his innings away once again!.
wktDetails:
234. MM Ali c J Yadav b Ashwin
Test Match#: 42.0: v England at Mohali in 2016 (2nd innings)

wktDetails:
235. BA Stokes lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 42.0: v England at Mohali in 2016 (2nd innings)

wktDetails:
236. JE Root c V Kohli b Ashwin
Test Match#: 43.0: v England at Wankhede in 2016 (1st innings)

description: and he's broken through! That man Ashwin again! Moeen has been keen to attack since tea. Goes for another sweep. Gets a big top edge this time which goes straight up in the air and lands in the hands of midwicket.
wktDetails:
237. MM Ali c KK Nair b Ashwin
Test Match#: 43.0: v England at Wankhede in 2016 (1st innings)

wktDetails:
238. KK Jennings c CA Pujara b Ashwin
Test Match#: 43.0: v England at Wankhede in 2016 (1st innings)

Pushed through on middle and leg, Bairstow gets low and looks to sweep hard. Doesn't account for some extra bounce, it takes the top edge and flies to backward square leg who runs in a few metres and takes a good catch in front of his midriff. India storming back.
wktDetails:
239. JM Bairstow c UT Yadav b Ashwin
Test Match#: 43.0: v England at Wankhede in 2016 (1st innings)

description: they are all up for an edge to slip! Given not out. Kohli reviews. More sharp turn. Like a little like his dismissal in Mohali. Yes, there's an edge here by the looks of it. Then it clips the keeper on the way to slip. Although the bat also hits the ground, could that be what makes the sound? But third umpire happy it's conclusive evidence a nick. Stokes isn't happy. He felt the bat hitting the ground.
wktDetails:
240. BA Stokes c V Kohli b Ashwin
Test Match#: 43.0: v England at Wankhede in 2016 (1st innings)

description: he's gone now! Can head off for some more treatment. Excellent catch by Parthiv. Sharp spin and bounce from outside off, cramps Ball for room and takes a top edge as he tries to play to the off side.
wktDetails:
241. JT Ball c PA Patel b Ashwin
Test Match#: 43.0: v England at Wankhede in 2016 (1st innings)

description: given again by umpire Oxenford. Stokes has a chat with the umpire and decides to walk off. The umpires just want to check if it has carried though? Or has it gone straight off the boot? Soft signal is out. Yes, lobbed off the boot. Flat delivery from Ashwin on off, Stokes gets low and reverse-sweeps onto his front shoe (off the inside edge), the ball pops up and carries low to Vijay at second slip, who came in and took the catch. wktDetails:
242. BA Stokes c M Vijay b Ashwin
Test Match#: 43.0: v England at Wankhede in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: another one, just before stumps. Yes, he has edged it. He's done his job though. Lots of flight on that on off, the topspinner. Ball gets forward and plays for some turn, but Ashwin ensured there wasn't much spin because of the variation. Ball gets a thin outside edge which is well held by Parthiv. India strike off the last ball of the day..
wktDetails:
243. JT Ball c PA Patel b Ashwin
Test Match#: 43.0: v England at Wankhede in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: done him this! It's a carrom ball. Bairstow reviews straightaway. Did it turn too much? Magnificent bowling, regardless. Squared up Bairstow on the back foot. Will it miss off stump? Nope! It's smashing off stump. That's a wonderful piece of deception and skill..
wktDetails:
244. JM Bairstow lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 43.0: v England at Wankhede in 2016 (2nd innings)

description: cleaned him up! There's no stopping Ashwin. This is a classical offspinner's dismissal. Tossed up outside off, lures Woakes into the drive and it spins through the gate. Poor shot, given the risk and reward.
wktDetails:
245. CR Woakes b  Ashwin
Test Match#: 43.0: v England at Wankhede in 2016 (2nd innings)

wktDetails:
246. AU Rashid c KL Rahul b Ashwin
Test Match#: 43.0: v England at Wankhede in 2016 (2nd innings)

wktDetails:
247. JM Anderson c UT Yadav b Ashwin
Test Match#: 43.0: v England at Wankhede in 2016 (2nd innings)

wktDetails:
248. BA Stokes c PA Patel b Ashwin
Test Match#: 44.0: v England at Chennai in 2016 (1st innings)

description: this has been happening way too often with Shakib. He gets set. He looks to dominate, then he plays a poor shot. A low percentage shot. wktDetails:
249. Shakib Al Hasan c UT Yadav b Ashwin
Test Match#: 45.0: v Bangladesh at Hyderabad in 2017 (1st innings)

description: and gone! Caught down the leg side. Flat delivery, a carrom ball down leg, Rahim looks to sweep but gets a bit of glove on that. That will be lunch too..
wktDetails:
250. Mushfiqur Rahim c WP Saha b Ashwin
Test Match#: 45.0: v Bangladesh at Hyderabad in 2017 (1st innings)

wktDetails:
251. Tamim Iqbal c V Kohli b Ashwin

wktDetails:
252. Mominul Haque c AM Rahane b Ashwin

wktDetails:
253. Mushfiqur Rahim c RA Jadeja b Ashwin

wktDetails:
254. Taskin Ahmed lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 45.0: v Bangladesh at Hyderabad in 2017 (2nd innings)

description: straight to midwicket! After all the hardwork, Smith chips his wicket away. wktDetails:
255. SPD Smith c V Kohli b Ashwin
Test Match#: 46.0: v Australia at Pune in 2017 (1st innings)

wktDetails:
256. MT Renshaw c M Vijay b Ashwin
Test Match#: 46.0: v Australia at Pune in 2017 (1st innings)

wktDetails:
257. MA Starc c RA Jadeja b Ashwin

wktDetails:
258. DA Warner lbw  Ashwin

wktDetails:
259. SE Marsh lbw  Ashwin
Test Match#: 46.0: v Australia at Pune in 2017 (2nd innings)

wktDetails:
260. PSP Handscomb c M Vijay b Ashwin

wktDetails:
261. MA Starc c KL Rahul b Ashwin
Test Match#: 46.0: v Australia at Pune in 2017 (2nd innings)

wktDetails:

wktDetails:

wktDetails:
264. DA Warner lbw  Ashwin

wktDetails:
265. MR Marsh c KK Nair b Ashwin

wktDetails:
